Submodules¶

batchgenerator.generators module¶

This file defines XmlBatchgenerators

class batchgenerator.generators.BatchGenerator(data_sources, label_map, batch_size=1, data_set_loader: batchgenerator.data.dataset.DataSetLoader = <batchgenerator.data.dataset.DataSetLoader object>, annotation_parser_loader: batchgenerator.data.wholeslideannotation.AnnotationParserLoader = <batchgenerator.data.wholeslideannotation.AnnotationParserLoader object>, sampler_loader=<batchgenerator.core.samplers.SamplerLoader object>, batch_sampler_loader=<batchgenerator.core.samplers.BatchSamplerLoader object>, sampler_controller_loader=<batchgenerator.core.controllers.SamplerControllerLoader object>, label_controller_loader=<batchgenerator.core.controllers.LabelControllerLoader object>, index_controller_loader=<batchgenerator.core.controllers.IndexControllerLoader object>, patch_sampler_loader=<batchgenerator.core.samplers.PatchSamplerLoader object>, label_sampler_loader=<batchgenerator.core.samplers.LabelSamplerLoader object>, point_sampler_loader=<batchgenerator.core.samplers.PointSamplerLoader object>, seed=123, queue_size=40, cpus=1, normalizer=<function normalize>, sample_callbacks=None, batch_callbacks=None, log_path=None)¶

Bases: object

An xml batch generation class which uses loaders and classes that allcan be customized by the user.

Parameters

  • data_sources (dict) –

    specification of datasource expecting the following hierachie (following is depedent by the annoation_parser_loader (see args)): {mode: {image_path: full_path_to_image_fill,

    annotation_path: full_path_to_annotation_file}}. were mode can be training or validation

  • label_map (dict) – label mapping between label names and label values.

  • batch_size – number of examples in batch

  • data_set_loader – loader class for loading a dataset (training/validation)

  • annototaion_parser_loader – laoder class for parsing annotations

  • sampler_loader – loader class for sampling patches and ground truth (and weights)

  • batch_sampler_loader – loader class for sampling batches

  • label_controller_loader – loader class for sampling a new label

  • index_controller_loader – loader class for sampling a new annotation (given a label)

  • label_sampler_loader – loader class for sampling ground truth

  • patch_sampler_loader – loader class for sampling a patch

  • point_sampler_loader – loader class for sampling a center point wihtin a given annotation

  • seed – seed number for random choices

  • queue_size – size of number of batches to maintain in memmory

  • cpus – number of cpus: 1 or >4 for multiprocessing

  • normalizer – normalize function for patches

  • sample_callbacks – callbacks applied to patch, mask, (weights)

  • batch_callbacks – callbacks applied to the batch

batch(mode)¶

returns a batch for a given mode (e.g.: training, validation)

property datasets¶
reset(mode)¶

reset the batch generator (currently not working)

start()¶

starts the batch generator (mandatory for multiprocessing (i.e., cpus>=4)

stop()¶

stops the batch generator and merges all logparts

class batchgenerator.generators.BatchGeneratorVanilla(data_sources, label_map, batch_size=1, input_shape=(256, 256, 3), spacing=0.5, task='segmentation', strict_point_sampling=False, seed=123, cpus=1, normalizer=<function normalize>, open_images_ahead=True, batch_callbacks=None, sample_callbacks=None, log_path=None)¶

Bases: batchgenerator.generators.BatchGenerator

An XmlBatchGenerator that has an easy interface that allows for basic functionality of the XmlBatchGenerator

Parameters

  • data_sources (dict) –

    specification of datasource expecting the following hierachie (following is depedent by the annoation_parser_loader (see args)): {mode: {image_path: full_path_to_image_fill,

    annotation_path: full_path_to_annotation_file}}. Example modes: training, validation

  • label_map (dict) – label mapping between label names and label values.

  • batch_size (int) – number of examples in batch

  • input_shape (tuple) – size of the patches

  • spacing (int) – pixel spacing of patches

  • task (str) – segmentation/classification

  • seed (int) – seed for randomness

  • cpus (int) – cpu cores that are used by the batch generator (>4 allows for multiprocessing)

  • normalizer (def) – normalizer to normalize patch data

  • sample_callbacks (list) – callbacks applied to patch, mask, (weights)

  • batch_callbacks (list) – callbacks applied to the batch

class batchgenerator.generators.WSIPatchGenerator(data_sources, batch_size=1, tile_shape=1024, 1024, 3, patch_shape=64, 64, 3, spacing=0.5, shift=1024, cpus=1, log_path=None)¶

Bases: batchgenerator.generators.BatchGenerator

This class generates patches in ordered fashion from a WSI. The annotation paths in the data_sourses should be replicates of the image_path. The WSIAnnotationParser will make sure that every sampling postion is converted to an annotation.

batch(mode)¶

returns a batch for a given mode (e.g.: training, validation)

block_shaped(nrows, ncols)¶
unblockshaped(h, w)¶
